```{r setup, include=FALSE}

  rm(list = ls())
  graphics.off()
  library(tibble)
  library(ggplot2)

```

```{r, include=FALSE}
  source("variables.R",local = knitr::knit_global())
```

This report represents a statistical analysis of the main thermodynamic variables. The figures below show the time evolution of Volume, temperature, pressure and density. The red lines are the linear regression of the values.

## Parameters

```{r, echo=FALSE}
  cat(paste("Ensemble:",ensemble))
  cat(paste("Number of frames:",frames))
  cat(paste("Timestep:",timestep))
  cat(paste("Number of atoms:",natoms))
```

## Volume

```{r, echo=FALSE}
  df %>% ggplot(aes(x=V1,y=V2))+
  geom_line(color="black")+
  geom_smooth(method = "lm",color="red")+
  theme_bw()+theme(panel.grid = element_blank())+
  labs(x="Time (ps)",y=expression(paste("Volume ",(ring(A)^3))))
```

Here is the statistical values of the volume of the unit cell.

```{r df$V2, echo=FALSE}
  summary(df$V2)
```
